alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Yellowstone; Southern Wheatland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 09 at 9:21PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, south central, and southeast Montana, including the following areas, in central Montana, Golden Valley, Judith Gap, Musselshell and Southern Wheatland. In south central Montana, Northeastern Yellowstone and Treasure. In southeast Montana, Carter, Custer, Fallon, Northern Rosebud and Powder River. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The ground remains saturated across the watch area, and it will not take very much rainfall, or very heavy rainfall rates, to result in excessive runoff and flooding. A cold front moving in from the northeast is expected to generate additional precipitation overnight tonight. Thus the watch will continue through 6 am Saturday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. If you are in a flood prone location be sure to have a way to receive warnings overnight that will wake you up to take action if necessary.
